result.execSummary:
The defendant Coleman L. Randall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. *Payment Plan:  $50.00/month, commencing November 1, 2016.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Coleman L. Randall in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to remove the enhancer, 947.01(1).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Atty Gumz agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court amends Ct. 1 to remove the enhancer, 947.01(1).

Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments. 

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge
  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing on November 1, 2016
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 5, 2016 at 09:45 am.
